formalpara.title: Figure 7. Spreading repression
formalpara.para: The C. elegans. X chromosome harbors multiple X-recognition elements (rex sites) that distinguish it from autosomes to recruit the dosage compensation complex. The complex binds to rex elements on both hermaphrodite X chromosomes and then spreads in cis to neighboring X regions that lack recruitment sites, thus establishing X-chromosome-wide repression that is maintained throughout the lifetime of the animal.
